info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 31 at 12:09PM CST until February 01 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...A period of light snow...possibly mixed with freezing drizzle late evening into the overnight. Total accumulations up to one inch. After 3 am and continuing into the daytime Tuesday look for west to northwest winds gusting to 45 mph causing areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, northwest and west central Minnesota. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 3 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
